question.body: Why do red blood cells need to expand elastically?

multiple_choice.choice: They need to expand when oxygen enters the cells.
They need to deform in order to fit through capillaries.
Red blood cells bind to other cells in the vessels.
Red blood cells bind to fibrin fibers to accentuate clots.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Oxygen binding to hemablobin at the nanoscale does not alter cell shape at the microscale.
Correct. Red cells squeeze through capillaries and tight spaces in the capillary beds of the lungs, liver and spleen.
Incorrect. Unless there is a serious pathological issue (such as malaria infection) red blood cells are not adhesive to vessel walls.
Incorrect. Red blood cells can interact with fibers, but they are not adhesive. platelets are.

part.hint: While flowing through the circulation, red blood cells regularly deform and regain their shape.
